story.storykicker: Municipal Corporation of Gurugram is not only showing apathy towards proper maintenance of ponds and lakes, but is also responsible for encroaching the land and constructing concrete structures there.
story.storybody:
Even as everyone is blaming high-rise apartments of Gurugram for the rampant extraction of groundwater, the main culprits are the civic agencies who are not giving importance to water conservation measures. Municipal Corporation of Gurugram is not only showing apathy towards proper maintenance of ponds and lakes, but is also responsible for encroaching the land and constructing concrete structures there.

PLIGHT OF RESIDENTS

Sirhaul village, situated between Iffco Chowk and Udyog Vihar, has two lakes with one of them being developed into a community centre while the other has been partially developed into a park. "In the past, these lakes were filled with water but now the channels coming from Aravallis have been blocked by the construction of residential and commercial sectors on the route. The entire area is surrounded by industrial units and residential houses which is the sole reason for the lakes turning dry," said Tippar Chand, watchman of the community centre in Sirhaul village. Somveer Yadav, a resident of same village said: "I have witnessed the greenery around this area when the lakes weren't dry.

LAKE ENCROACHED BY GOVT AGENCY

Now, the lake has been completely encroached by the government agency. It is hard to understand why they are killing a water conservation zone? The civic agency should make alternate arrangements to fill water in these lakes as they are natural groundwater recharge zones. The rain water could fill these lakes during Monsoon." MCG has also encroached another lake in Dundehera village near sector 21 and developed it into water restoration tanks to supply water to the residential as well as commercial localities.

When contacted: an official of the MCG told Mail Today that it was fault of town and country planning department leading to such a mess. "If we have no source of water, how could we manage to maintain water in lakes," the official said. MCG deputy commissioner TL Satya Prakash said: "It was an old decision to develop a community centre or park in lands of lake however we will check revenue records to find out who was responsible for it".
